metadata.title: CVE-2016-9888 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An error within the "tar_directory_for_file()" function (gsf-infile-tar.c)in GNOME Structured File Library before 1.14.41 can be exploited to triggera Null pointer dereference and subsequently cause a crash via a crafted TARfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gsf-1 - 1.14.41-1
libgsf-1-114 - 1.14.41-1
libgsf-1-common - 1.14.41-1
libgsf-bin - 1.14.41-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgsf package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.14.41-1').
